argument.name: Bytes_Written
argument.description: The number of bytes written to the file.

argument.name: blob
argument.description: A variable or expression containing binary data.

page.discussion: The .WRITEB() method transfers the contents of a blob to the location of the current file pointer in the open file referenced by the object pointer. This function is useful for writing binary data to a file.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example converts a bitmap created in memory into JPEG format, then writes it to file.
section.example: dim saveb as B dim savej as B dim fptr as P ui_bitmap_create("test", width, height) ui_bitmap_draw("test",<<%code% ... %code%) saveb = ui_bitmap_save("test") savej = bitmap_to_jpeg(saveb) fptr = file.create("c:\was\chart.jpg", FILE_RW_EXCLUSIVE) fptr.writeb(savej) fptr.close()
